properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 12 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Ruteme (Bugarama, Rumonge). 5 people were killed.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 12 September 2020, an unidentified armed group clashed with military forces in Kayombe (Bugarama, Rumonge). 1 person was killed and 3 were injured.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 12 September 2020 (between 11 - 13 September), an unidentified armed group beheaded an ex-FAB soldier in his home in Gatsinga (Ndava, Mwaro). The motive remains unknown.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: On 11 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and military forces in Gahuni (Bugarama, Rumonge). 4 Red Tabara and 1 civilian were killed. 2 police were injured. 1 Red-Tabara was arrested by police.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 10 September 2020, an unidentified armed group threw 2 grenades at homes on Kinogono avenue in Buyenzi (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). 1 Imbonerakure was killed and 4 were injured.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.notes: On 7 September 2020, Imbonerakure and SNR attacked, injured and arrested a CNL leader in Murambi (Muramvya, Muramvya).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 7 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 3 judges while they were visiting a disputed piece of land in Ntahangwa (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 6 September 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 1 civilian in Gahuni (Bugarama, Rumonge). The attackers also stole the victim's cows.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 6 September 2020, a communal administrator and 2 Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 Tutsi students in Buhiga commune (Buhiga, Karuzi). The administrator was shouting racial slurs at them for being Tutsi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 6 September 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked and killed 3 civilians, including the head of the Imbonerakure of this hill, his wife, and another woman in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). Another man was injured. The armed men disappeared into the forest. It did not appear the Imbonerakure was armed or any fighting occurred.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 6 September 2020, Red Tabara clashed with Imbonerakure in Kagano (Bukeye, Muramvya). 1 person was killed and others were injured. 1 Imbonerakure was abducted by the rebels.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.source: Arib; SOS Medias; Radio Publique Africaine
properties.notes: On 6 September 2020, Red Tabara attacked and killed 3 civilians in Maramvya (Burambi, Rumonge). At least 2 other people were injured. Of the three people killed, one was the Imbonerakure leader of that hillside. He was unarmed in his home when the attackers came and killed him. Of the injured civilians, one was the director of a school and also a CNDD-FDD activist.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 5 September 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Kinama (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). The CNL member was attacked for leaving the CNDD-FDD to join the CNL. He is now in the hospital.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 5 September 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and killed a CNL member in Mukenke (Bwambarangwe, Kirundo). Police then arrested several Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 3 September 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted an Imbonerakure in Kagaragara, Buringa zone (Gihanga, Bubanza). He has yet to be found.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 3 September 2020, a group of Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Rugombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke). He was beaten for 2 hours because he refused to join the CNDD-FDD party. The victim's family and other CNL officials were arrested this morning.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 3 September 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed an unknown number of civilians (coded as 3) in Mukike commune (Bujumbura Rural). Other civilians were kidnapped. This group may have been linked to RED-TABARA, operating in this location in recent days.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 2 September 2020, police SNR attacked, injured and arrested a civilian in Gisagazuba (Burambi, Rumonge). The civilian was accused of partnering with rebel groups.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 2 September 2020, police SNR attacked, injured and imprisoned 3 young men in Namande (Rusaka, Mwaro) who were accused of being rebels.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 2 September 2020, police and Imbonerakure abducted 10 Tutsi civilians from Mugamba commune (Bururi).

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.notes: On 1 September 2020, the SNR abducted 2 civilians, one who was associated with the CNL, in Namande (Rusaka, Mwaro). 5 total were arrested, but 3 of the men have been found in jail. The other 2 men's whereabouts are unknown. They were accused of collaborating with rebel movements.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 1 September 2020, police and SNR abducted 2 CNL members in Muramvya (Muramvya, Muramvya). They have not been found since this time.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On 1 September 2020, police arrested 40 civilians in Buganda (Buganda, Cibitoke) who are accused of having connections to the RED-TABARA attacks and clashes in the days preceding the arrest. Many were young people and former military.

properties.notes: On 29 August 2020, military forces, Imbonerakure, police and a CNDD-FDD member clashed with an unidentified armed group in Kayange zone (Musigati, Bubanza). An Imbonerakure and a CNDD-FDD member were killed.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 29 August 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians in Busimba (Muramvya, Muramvya). This group is likely linked to broader RED-TABARA attacks in recent days in this area and the group was wearing military clothing. 1 man was killed and 2 wounded.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 28 August 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked Ndayi (Mukike, Bujumbura Rural). 2 civilians were killed, 3 injured and 10 abducted.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Around 28 August 2020, Imbonerakure abducted and killed the former vice president of the commission in charge of the elections in Kirundo commune near Munzenze (Busoni, Kirundo). His body has yet to be found, but sources claim the body was left in the Murehe nature reserve.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 28 August 2020, an unidentified armed group, between 12 and 40 in size, took 4 men hostage in Masare (Musigati, Bubanza) to help transport food to Kibira nature reserve. No fatalities/injuries reported.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 25 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with military forces and Imbonerakure in Ku Nyoni, a location on the border between Mugamba commune (Bururi) and Burambi commune (Rumonge). 2 Imbonerakure and 1 Burundian solider were killed. 2 hostages were released. Rebels continued in the direction of Buyengero.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.notes: On 24 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and Imbonerakure in Gitaza zone (Muhuta, Rumonge) across two days of fighting. At least 5 Red Tabara rebels, 9 police, between 10 and 20 Imbonerakure, and 11 civilians, who were previously abducted, were killed. Fatalities split across 2 events.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 24 August 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade inside the house of a civilian in Nyantakara (Kayogoro, Makamba). The man was injured.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.source: Radio Publique Africaine; Reuters; SOS Medias
properties.notes: On 23 August 2020, Red Tabara clashed with police and Imbonerakure in Gitaza zone (Muhuta, Rumonge) across two days of fighting. At least 5 Red Tabara rebels, 9 police, between 10 and 20 Imbonerakure, and 11 civilians, who were previously abducted, were killed. Fatalities split across 2 events.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: On 23 August 2020, between 70 and 100 Red Tabara abducted at least 11 civilians in Gahuni zone (Bugarama, Rumonge). They also looted belongings.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 23 August 2020, military and Imbonerakure clashed at the stadium in Rubombo commune (Rugombo, Cibitoke). More than 100 Imbonerakure were doing paramilitary exercises, dressed as military, when the Burundian military discovered them, stripped, beat and injured them. Military forces reported this was done in an effort to dismantle all groups that replace the police and military. No casualties reported.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 23 August 2020, 3 Imbonerakure attacked and injured 2 fishermen on Cohoha lake, Bugabira commune (Bugabira, Kirundo). The fishermen were told that they were not allowed to fish since they are not CNDD-FDD party members.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 23 August 2020, police fought against rioters when they attempted to arrest a CNL member and the population resisted the arrest in Ndava zone (Buganda, Cibitoke). 1 person was injured. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 22 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed a civilian in Kigaga (Ntega, Kirundo). The civilian was found to be in possession of a child's head, so the Imbonerakure killed him.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 22 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and killed 2 civilians in Maramvya zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 19 August 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a taxi driver, his body found in a state of decomposition behind the University of Burundi in Nyakabiga (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie). He had been abducted the previous week.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: Around 17 August 2020 (as reported), 3 police attacked and killed a civilian in Maramvya zone (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural).

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On 17 August 2020, Burundian military shot and killed a farmer in Rukoko Nature Reserve (Gihanga, Bubanza). A curfew of 5pm had been imposed in that area due to recent rebel movements.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 17 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a judge during his arrest in Matongo commune (Matongo, Kayanza).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Tanzania)
properties.notes: On 16 August 2020, an unknown armed group from Tanzania attacked, killed and looted from a Burundian civilian, injuring 2 others along the border in Cekenya village, Mayange zone (Kayogoro, Makamba).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 15 August 2020, Imbonerakure threw a grenade into the workplace of a CNL member, injuring 4 people, including a child, in Rubirizi sub hill, Bukemba commune (Gitanga, Rutana). The attack is believed to be aimed at the CNL member who is a candidate in the next hill elections.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 15 August 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a civilian in Muheka (Songa, Bururi).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On 14 August 2020, police abducted a CNL member in Kabumba (Kanyosha, Bujumbura). As of one week later, he had not been located in any jails. The man had twice previously avoided assassination attempts due to his outspoken political opinions.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 13 August 2020, an unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a salon, killing 3 children in Gahahe, Kinama zone (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie). 8 others were injured. One Imbonerakure has been arrested as a potential suspect.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 12 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian at a bar on Sarongo hill, Ruyaga zone (Kanyosha, Bujumbura Rural). He was drinking with his friends when he was accused of speaking against the ruling party.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 12 August 2020, Imbonerakure and a local hill chief attacked and injured a CNL member in Karagara (Rumonge, Rumonge).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 11 August 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted a CNL member from Buterere area of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 10 August 2020, police SNR abducted a CNL supporter in Ngozi (Ngozi, Ngozi). The CNL supporter has not been seen since the abduction.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a student, his body found near the Jiji River in Bururi province.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group beheaded a 12 year old boy in Kanyabitumwe (Buyengero, Rumonge).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), 5 people, including 3 children, were injured by the detonation of a grenade found by the children in Gifurwe (Mpanda, Bubanza).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 10 August 2020 (between 1 and 21 August), an unidentified armed group attacked and killed a man. His body was found in a tree plantation in Ndagano (Vyanda, Bururi).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 8 August 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a civilian in Mugera (Mishiha, Cankuzo). The victim was a launderer who was late on cleaning the clothes of an Imbonerakure, so they severely beat him up.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 6 August 2020 (as reported), 12 bodies of Burundian soldiers were discovered in the Barikore valley area of Gafumbegeti (Mabayi, Cibitoke). Some may have been civilians or Imbonerakure in civilian clothes. During this week, locals heard shots coming from the Kabira forest and some fled the area. This province has been the site of ongoing recent clashes with rebel groups.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 4 August 2020, teachers protested outside the teachers' bank in Bujumbura (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie), against an increase of their monthly contributions. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On 30 July 2020, police arrested 50 people after searching for weapons in Muha area in Bujumbura city (Mukaza, Bujumbura Mairie).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 30 July 2020, an unidentified armed group destroyed four homes and stole eight goats of CNL members in Nyamugari (Mugongo-Manga, Bujumbura Rural).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 29 July 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Mibanda (Rumonge, Rumonge). The Imbonerakure was subsequently arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 28 July 2020 (as reported), 4 Burundian soldiers' bodies were discovered on Myave hill (Bukinanyana, Cibitoke). This area has been the location of ongoing clashes between Burundian military and armed groups from Rwanda.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 26 July 2020, a group of locals attacked and injured a woman who previously killed her husband in Mugera (Mishiha, Cankuzo). After the woman had been beaten by the mob, she was arrested by police. [size=no report].

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Around 25 July 2020 (as reported), a group of at least 7 people fought with Imbonerakure in Bitezi (Matana, Bururi). Police arrested 7 people following the fighting. The motives for this were unclear and no fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=at least 7]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 24 July 2020, an Imbonerakure attacked and injured a journalist in Mugina commune (Mugina, Cibitoke). The attack occurred during an election for communal administrator.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: Around 23 July 2020 (as reported), police forces arrested 110 CNL members in Kiremba commune (Ngozi) during the electoral period.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 23 July 2020 (as reported), the body of a CNL member was discovered after being attacked by an unidentified armed group in Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Around 22 July 2020 (as reported), the bodies of 5 soldiers were found in the Kibira forest area of Gafumbegete (Mabayi, Cibitoke), killed by an unidentified armed group. This province has been the site of ongoing recent clashes with rebel groups.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 22 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured a CNL member in Munyinya (Busoni, Kirundo). The member later died from his injuries.

properties.actor1: Interahamwe Militia
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.source: IWACU; Radio Publique Africaine; SOS Medias
properties.notes: On 20 July 2020, Interahamwe clashed with Burundian military forces and Imbonerakure in Kabira forest near Torero and Gafumbegeti hills in Butahana zone (Mabayi, Cibitoke). 7 Burundian soldiers were killed and at least 4 were injured. 5 from the Interahamwe were captured and sent back to Rwanda. The hill chief of Gafumbegeti was arrested on accusations of collaborating with the Interahamwe.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 19 July 2020, an unidentified armed group burned the home of a former East African community parliamentarian in Mitakataka (Bubanza, Bubanza). No fatalities and/or injuries reported. The reason for this destruction of property is unclear.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 19 July 2020, Imbonerakure attacked and injured 6 CNL members in Kwisigu (Busoni, Kirundo). The 6 CNL members were running for local elections.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 1 December 2019, a crowd came together to beat up a police officer in Tenga zone, Mutimbuzi after the officer attempted to shoot civilians in a bar. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

The military major leading this group of soldiers was killed in the attack.

Coded across the 3 events with fatalities dividided.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Night of 26 October to 27 October 2019. Local residents of Gihanga, Cibitoke witnessed a large movement of an unidentified armed group from DRC to Gihanga, Cibitoke province. These are likely RED-TABARA and FOREBU joining other militants in Kibira in ongoing fighting with state military forces.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 25 October 2019. An unidentified armed group shot and wounded a local administrator on Muyira hill, Bujumbura Rural. Several CNL members were arrested following the attack, and are accused of carrying out the shooting.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.source: Iyakure TV; Radio Publique Africaine; Twitter
properties.notes: 24 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants clashed with military forces on Masare hill, Musigati. 1 soldier was killed during the clash.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: On or before 24 October 2019. Police forces clashed with RED-TABARA and FOREBU in Matongo commune, Kayanza. 1 RED-TABARA was arrested by police before RED-TABARA and FOREBU retreated back to Kibira.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 24 October 2019. An attack continued for the second day as Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD members beat up civilian supporters of the CNL party in Nyamarobe, Kiremba during the opening of a CNL party building.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Week of 23 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed property at the Kirundo commune CNL party building two times during the week of 23 October. CNDD-FDD supporters are likely behind this.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On or before 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure abducted and killed a civilian CNL supporter in Gihanga commune, Bubanza [coded at geoprecision 2]. His body was found in Gihanga commune on 23 October. This may be part of broader operations against CNL members by police with the help of Imbonerakure for collaborating with RED-TABARA.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure, a CNDD-FDD secretary and hill chief beat up a CNL supporter in Kigaza, Kayogoro for spreading CNL ideology.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: 23 October 2019. The RED-TABARA and FOREBU coalition move forces into the forest of Magufa, Bururi commune [coded at geoprecision 2].

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 23 October 2019. Imbonerakure and CNDD-FDD members attacked civilian supporters of the CNL party in Nyamarobe, Kiremba during the opening of a CNL party building. One CNL supporter was hospitalized but no casualties were reported.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 23 October 2019. 'Many' people are arrested by police forces in Musigati, Bubanza and taken to undisclosed locations following clashes between RED-TABARA/FOREBU and Burundi security forces.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 22 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants clash with military forces, police and Imbonerakure in Musigati commune, Bubanza near or in the Kibira forest [coded at geoprecision 2]. Following the fighting, the RED-TABARA/FOREBU retreated to Kibira to join two other groups of RED-TABARA/FOREBU already in the forest. 14 RED-TABARA and 1 policeman killed, as well as several wounded and weapons seized.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed a CNL party building on Mutara hill, Karuzi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 October 2019. The demobilized Buramata hill leader of the Imbonerakure was killed by other Imbonerakure on Buramata hill, Gihanga, for collaborating with RED-TABARA.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: 22 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants abducted 20 civilians including the hill chief in Mitakataka, Bubanza commune. They were later released on Ruziba hill, Musigati commune.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroy the home of a CNL party representative in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural.

properties.actor1: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: 21 October 2019. RED-TABARA and FOREBU militants enter the Kibira forest in Musigati commune [coded at geoprecision 2], Bubanza in two separate groups.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Twa Ethnic Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 18 October 2019. Imbonerakure attacked three Batwa civilian supporters of the CNL on Shoza hill, Nyamurenza for participating in CNL meetings. No casualties were reported in the attack.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 October 2019. Imbonerakure destroyed the CNL party building in Gitaza, Muhuta.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 October 2019. An Imbonerakure attacked a civilian member of the CNL with a machete in Mutara, Kirundo. Local residents were able to intervene to stop the attack and take the civilian to the hospital.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Butahana, Gitobe.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 October 2019. A CNL supporter and teacher were arrested and beaten by SNR and police forces in Buhiga commune, Karuzi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 October 2019. A CNL party building was destroyed by Imbonerakure in Murwi, Cibitoke.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
properties.notes: On or before 16 October 2019. SNR agents arrested 43 people suspected of having links to CNL and RED-TABARA in Cibitoke province. They are being held at the prison in Cibitoke.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Mutumba, Karuzi. CNL members blame the Imbonerakure for the destruction of property.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: In the month of October 2019, CNL and CNDD-FDD clashed in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi, following the opening of a CNL party building. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Around 15 October 2019 (weeks before 7 November 2019), Imbonerakure attacked and killed a member of the CNL in Burenza (Marangara, Ngozi).

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 15 October 2019. An unidentified armed group destroyed a CNL party building in Muhuta commune, Rumonge. Police arrested CNL leaders and accused them of destroying their own building to blame it on Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 October 2019, a student was kidnapped by an unidentified armed group near Musaga, Bujumbura.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: 13 October 2019. A civilian accused of supporting rebels in DRC was arrested by SNR and killed by the prison guards at the SNR office in Ndava, Buganda. His body was dumped in the Rusizi river.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 October 2019. Imbonerakure and CNL members clashed in Cewe zone, Kirundo during the inauguration of the CNL party building. Two Imbonerakure were injured in the clash. Local administration barred the opening of the CNL building following the clash.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 October 2019. A man and wife who left the CNDD-FDD party for the CNL party were beaten up by Imbonerakure in Mutara, Kirundo.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 October. A CNL party building was destroyed by Imbonerakure and the zone leader in Gasenyi zone, Buganda.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 11 October 2019. 4 Imbonerakure tortured a civilian CNL supporter by burning plastic on his body in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 11 October 2019. Imbonerakure infiltrated into the prison in the main prison of Bujumbura, and attacked prisoners who were arrested for political reasons. 1 prisoner was killed in the attack.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 0n or before 10 October. Several Imbonerakure members including the provincial leader of Ruyigi are arrested and tortured in Ruyigi city prison during detainment by police forces and SNR. They are suspected to have attempted the assassination of the CNDD-FDD provincial leader in Ruyigi.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 10 October. University students demonstrated in Gitega city, Gitega over lack of government stipends to support them. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 10 October. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Nyabiraba commune. The CNL blames the CNDD-FDD for this attack after the chief of the commune vowed that no CNL party buildings may exist in the commune. This is the second CNL party building to be destroyed in Nyabiraba.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 October. Imbonerakure beat up CNL supporters in a bar in Kirundo city. A police officer intervened to stop the attack, but was also beaten up and accused of being a CNL supporter. 5 were injured in the attack and property destroyed at the bar.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 07 October. Students demonstrated in Rumonge city, Rumonge against the closure of their secondary school. Students demanded that the principle find another school for them to study. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 05 October. Civil society organisations and CNDD-FDD supporters demonstrated in Gitega city, Gitega against the extension of the mandate of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 05 October. CNDD-FDD and Imbonerakure demonstrated in Nyamurenza, Ngozi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. Civilians were forced not to work by Imbonerakure upon seizure of tools or imposing fees. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 05 October. An unidentified armed group killed an Imbonerakure in Munyange, Busiga. 14 CNL supporters have been arrested as suspected perpetrators.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 October. Civil society organisations, CNDD-FDD supporters and students demonstrated in Ngozi city, Ngozi against the extension of the mandate of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi. [size='not a large number']

properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 05 October. CNDD-FDD, Imbonerakure and many government administrators demonstrated in Karuzi city, Karuzi against the extension of the UN Commission of Inquiry in Burundi and recent political statements made by Burundian Catholic church leaders. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 04 October. A government minister, Jean Marie Vianney Rugerinyange, in the Ministry of Culture and Sport was killed by an unidentified armed group at his home in Kinanira 4 neighborhood in Musaga, Bujumbura Mairie.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 October. Imbonerakure beat up a CNL supporter in Rushubije, Ntega.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: Students (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
properties.notes: On October 3, A secondary school student and CNL supporter was attacked by Imbonerakure at a school in Nyamurenza commune, Ngozi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 October. A UPRONA supporter was attacked by an unidentified armed group in Rugari, Karugunda near his home. He was hit over the head with a piece of concrete. This event occurred near the same location as the destruction of a bridge by Imbonerakure in the same week to prevent a CNL meeting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Early in the month of October. 4 Imbonerakure beat up a CNL supporter in Nyarusange, Ngozi. Police arrested the Imbonerakure following the attack.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 01 October. Imbonerakure destroyed the crops of a CNL zone leader in Kamira hill, Ngozi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Month of October 2019, an Imbonerakure raped a 16 year old female student in Kivoga zone, Rutana. The Imbonerakure then went on the run from authorities.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 01 October. An unidentified armed group destroyed the CNL party building in Kagongo, Rumonge. Imbonerakure or CNDD-FDD supporters are likely behind the destruction of property, though neither have been confirmed.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: Near 1 October 2019. A CNDD-FDD and zone leader abducted a civilian from Kigoma zone, Buhiga. The location of the civilian is unknown since the disappearance.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 September. Imbonerakure destroyed a bridge connecting Nonwe and Kibazi to prevent CNL supporters from crossing over a river to open a new party building.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 September. Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters in Kagari zone, Muyinga for attending the opening of a CNL party building.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 September. Imbonerakure attacked several civilians during a political rally by the Imbonerakure in Rugombo, Cibitoke. 2 civilian is in critical condition.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 28 September. Police forces assaulted a group of 7th Day Adventists praying together in their church building in Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie. This is part of ongoing violence against 7th Day Adventists for not supporting the CNDD-FDD party.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 27 September. 4 soldiers were found dead in the Rusizi river in Nyamitanga, Cibitoke following a clash with an unidentified armed group.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 September. 6 Imbonerakure attacked 2 CNL supporters in Rango, Kayanza for participating in the opening of a CNL party building.

properties.actor1: Mutambu Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 23 September. A communal armed group from Mutambu destroyed banana plantations in Raro area of Nyabiraba commune, Bujumbura Rural over a land dispute.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.notes: 23 September. Students from DRC demonstrated in Bujumbura against the arrest and deportation of 138 DRC students by Burundian police forces for not having proper residence paperwork. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 September. A CNL supporter was attacked and killed by Imbonerakure on Mushikanwa hill, Gihogazi. Imbonerakure claim the CNL supporter was involved in sorcery.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 23 September. CNDD-FDD zone leader beat up several CNL supporters and looted livestock in Kibezi, Kiremba. The CNDD-FDD zone leader says that he does not want any CNL supporters in Kibezi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 22 September. A Pentecostal Church pastor was abducted by an unidentified armed group after leaving Kirundo for Bujumbura. Many suspect he was abducted by CNDD-FDD members for raising money for Burundian refugees in Rwanda, though this has not been confirmed.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 22 September. The Mugongomanga communal administrator attacked a woman in Jenda zone, Mugongomanga.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 21 September. Police forces broke into a 7th Day Adventist church and beat up a woman in the Rubuye area of Ngozi city, Ngozi. This may be part of ongoing political tension between the CNDD-FDD and the 7th Day Adventist Church who are accused of being politically supportive of the CNL.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
properties.notes: 21 September. Imbonerakure beat up a woman who supports the CNL party in Rutabo hill, Kirundo.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 September. Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Buhurika zone, Musigati commune. Police arrived to break up the fighting. No casualties were reported in the fighting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 September. Imbonerakure and CNL supporters clashed in Bukinga zone, Musigati commune. Police arrived to break up the fighting. No casualties were reported in the fighting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 20 September. Imbonerakure destroyed property in Rumonge city, Rumonge after a Presidential visit to the city. This was likely in retaliation against low civilian interest in the Presidential rally. Police and military forces also blocked access to the market, prevented bus travel and may have been involved in the destruction of property.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On Jul 16th, in Bugera, two members of the CNL were attacked and seriously injured by Imbonerakure. No fatalities reported.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 July. CNL and Imbonerakure clashed in Rwaniro, Murago, injuring one Imbonerakure. Police arrested CNL members following the clash.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 July. The CNL party building was destroyed by unidentified armed group in Minago, Rumonge.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 July. An unidentified armed group attacked and injured a civilian in Buhiga, Karuzi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 July. Imbonerakure attacked civilian supporters of the CNL in Gasenyi, Rusamaza, Karuzi. The CNL supporters were then arrested by the police and held in jail.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat civilians associated with a local CNL representative on Nyungu, Muyinga. The CNL representative was beaten and taken to prison for three days.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat and injured two CNL supporters, provoking clashes between CNL and Imbonerakure in Gitanga area of Gashikanwa. Police intervened to make arrests with one police officer injured by a machete by a CNL supporter.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 July. The walls and doors of a CNL party building were vandalized in Muhanga commune, Kayanza.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 July. Imbonerakure attacked, looted and destroyed property of the CNL leader in Muyinga, Mushikamo, Muramvya.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 14 July. CNDD-FDD supporters beat a civilian member of CNL and accused him of spying on their meeting on Mutobo, Mukike.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 July. Imbonerakure beat a group of CNL supporters for holding a meeting in Murungurira, Ntega. Police intervened and arrested the CNL supporters.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 13 July. A CNDD-FDD and CNL supporter clashed with each other with machetes in Kabasi, Bitare over a political argument concerning the 2020 election.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 13 July. A civilian is found dead, tied up and wrapped in a mosquito net in Nyarwumba, Cibitoke.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 12 July. An unidentified armed group burned and destroyed homes at the displaced persons site in Musenyi, Ngozi province.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 12 July. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian in Nyarwumba, Cibitoke province. The body was found near the Kibira forest with two bullet wounds in the head and chest.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Government of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Farmers (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 11 July 2019, Imbonerakure with a CNDD-FDD party leader and local government administrator attacked and killed 2 civilians, a farmer and a CNL supporter, in the Kinama area of Bujumbura (Ntahangwa, Bujumbura Mairie).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 11 July. Police arrested and publicly killed two civilian CNL members accused of theft in Buramata, Gihanga. Others who took photos of the execution or who were near the victims have been arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 10 July. A hill chief raped a woman in Ruvyagira, Ruyigi.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On or before 10 July. Police forces shot and arrested a civilian in Bugarama, Muramvya. The attack is suspected to be connected to an assault by Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: On or before 09 July. Police arrest the political party leader of the RANAC, Aloys Baricako, and hold him at the main prison in Ngozi.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 08 July. A mob threw rocks at the communal CNL party building in Rutagage, Ngozi. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 08 July. An unidentified armed group killed a civilian in Gabiro-Ruvyagira, Rugombo.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 07 July. 2 Imbonerakure abducted and tortured a young civilian, who was later released by a police officer in Buhiga, Ngayane.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 07 July. A group of 7 suspected Imbonerakure attacked a CNL party member and 2 other civilians in Rugabano, Mwakiro.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 July. Imbonerakure armed with clubs blocked roads and prevented CNL supporters from attending a political meeting in Butare, Kayogoro.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 July. A CNL secretary was killed by Imbonerakure in Kigarama, Kayanza province.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 05 July. Police shoot a taxi bicyclist in the knee for consuming an illegal drink in Mugerama, Nyanza-Lac.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 July. A CNL party member and FNL party member fought each other in Butamuheba, Gitega. The FNL party supporter was severely injured. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 July. An unidentified armed group beheaded a civilian in Buhoro, Mabayi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 04 July. An unidentified armed group detonate an explosive in Makamba city, Makamba. No casualties were reported in the explosion.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) Rapid Mobile Intervention Group
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 04 July. Police Rapid Mobile Intervention Group arrest an Imbonerakure suspect of planning an uprising against a fourth mandate of the president in Gitega. The Imbonerakure is transferred to Bujumbura and cannot be found since.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 03 July. Police forces beat and arrested a woman in Busongo, Gihanga in Bubanza. Police accused the woman of hiding her husband who they suspected of attacking Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: CNL: National Congress for Liberation
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 July. A group of Imbonerakure clashed with 4 CNL supporters in Nderama, Bukinanyana.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: Near 03 July. A woman is found dead, it is suspected she was killed by police forces, in Kajiji area of Kanyosha, Mboza.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 July. A civilian is found dead in Rusiga, 2 km from Cibitoke city, killed by an unidentified armed group.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 July. Police forces clashed with an unidentified armed group in Gatumba, Mutimbuzi near the DRC border. The assailants were attempting to abduct or steal from a vehicle, when security forces intervened and killed one assailant.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 July. Imbonerakure abducted and beat a civilian in Nyabigina, Nyanza-Lac.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 July. An unidentified group set fire to the fence of the CNL party leader in Rutegama commune, Muramvya. Some suspected police and Imbonerakure may be behind this incident.

properties.actor1: FNL: National Forces of Liberation
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 July. A FNL militant shot and injured an Imbonerakure in Busongo, Gihanga.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 01 July. A woman was arrested and then killed by police forces in Kanyosha, Mboza.

properties.actor1: Kazirabageni Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 01 July. Two refugee returnees attacked a civilian on Buheka, Nyanza-Lac over a land dispute between several families in the area.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Between 01-04 July. Imbonerakure abducted and raped a young girl in Monge-Kiramata, Ntega. She was captured on the 1st and released by the 4th of July, but prevented by authorities from seeking medical treatment.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 01 July. Police forces kill a civilian member of CNDD-FDD on Ruziba, Bukinanyana.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 01 July. A soldier killed a civilian on Gahoma hill, Mabayi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction); Government of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 30 June. The CNDD-FDD head of the zone in Kirundo assaulted a woman, when a local teacher intervened to stop the attack. The head of the zone then had the intervening teacher detained by Imbonerakure members in Gitobe quarter, Kirundo city.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 30 June. A group of CNL supporters attacked and beat the hill chief in Karamagi, Kirundo during the opening of the provincial party headquarters.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 30 June. A group of Imbonerakure detained and beat civilian supporters of CNL in Gitobe, Butihinda during the opening of the provincial party headquarters.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 30 June. A group of Imbonerakure attacked a civilian on Gitongo, Gitega.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 30 June. After a group of Imbonerakure attacked a civilian on Gitongo, Gitega (coded separately). During the night, victim's family retaliated and beat one of the Imbonerakure assailants.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 30 June. Two civilians were found dead, killed by an unidentified armed group in Rusiga, 1 km from the Cibitoke city.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 June. An unidentified armed group severely beat a civilian CNDD-FDD member and school director on Buhindo hill, Murwi, Cibitoke.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 June. Imbonerakure members, under the instruction of the Rurambira hill chief, beat two students of Tutsi ethnicity in Gishiha, Vugizo. Imbonerakure members told the students the country does not belong to Tutsis anymore.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 June. An unidentified group killed a civilian in Nyamiyaga, Gihogazi over witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 June. Imbonerakure members attacked a CNL supporter in Rukago, Gahombo, Kayanza before taking him to prison.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 29 June. CNDD-FDD supporters protested in Bujumbura against Human Rights Watch and International Crisis Group. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 28 June. A taxi-moto driver is found dead in the Kigwena forest reserve in Rumonge, killed by an unidentified armed group. This is the second taxi moto corps found in this location within a month.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 28 June. Dozens of Imbonerakure attacked CNL supporters on Nyakibande and Gishingiro (no coordinates available) in Nyambuye, Bujumbura Rural. Afterwards, the CNL supporters were taken to the police station

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 28 June. A senior government army minister was abducted from Bujumbura by an unidentified armed group.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 June. 4 Imbonerakure abducted and tortured a CNL supporter on Kaninga hill in Butanuka, Bubanza. The victim was found on 29 June arrested at the police station.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 June. Imbonerakure members attacked 2 members of the CNL in Susa, Murungurira.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 June. Imbonerakure and the hill chief beat a woman in Rwingoma, Buhiga over a family dispute.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 June. Imbonerakure assaulted and looted goods from a civilian supporter of CNL in Kibago hill of Makamba, after the CNL supporter was accused of going against a referendum and collecting food from rebels.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 June. Imbonerakure beat a CNL supporter in Rubimba, Kibago for supporting the CNL.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 June. Imbonerakure and the hill chief clashed with a police officer in Nkonyovu, Rutegama. Some suspect it may have stemmed from the Tutsi ethnicity of the police officer.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 23 June. An unidentified armed group burned three homes in Karera 1, Musongati over a land conflict.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.assoc_actor_2: Women (Burundi); CNL: National Congress for Liberation
properties.notes: 23 June. A female CNL member was beaten and detained by Imbonerakure in Rutana city. She was taken to prison and held for switching political parties.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 June. Imbonerakure attacked a CNL supporter in Bucana, Kirundo. Police arrest two of the Imbonerakure following the attack.

properties.actor1: Kibavu Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 June. Residents of Kibavu, Ruganza clashed with an Imbonerakure militant, after the militant killed his wife and child.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 21 June. A CNL member was strangled and killed by an unidentified armed group in Kigoma, Bugabira. The body was left in the Gacamirinda river.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 20 June. Police searched residents, and arrested 80 people for not having an identity card. They also beat a moto-taxi driver in Makamba city, Makamba.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 20 June. Moto-taxi drivers protested over police brutality, following an incident involving on the same day in Makamba, Makamba province. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 19 June. A civilian was beaten into a coma by police forces after an arrest for violence against his spouse and refusing to pay a bribe in Nyarusange, Musigat.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 June. Two civilians were attacked for crossing the river to Rwanda by Imbonerakure and the hill chief in Kigaga, Ntega. After holding them overnight, they were taken to the police station.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 June. The hill leader of the Imbonerakure attacked and seriously injured a civilian in Nyabigina, Nyarutuntu.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 June. Imbonerakure assaulted a civilian CNL mobiliser for supporting Rwasa. The assailants destroyed his fields and took him to the police in Kireka, Gikuyo.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with police and Imbonerakure members in Gihanga commune of Bubanza, near the Rukoko nature reserve. 3 Imbonerakure and 2 police are wounded in the fighting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 June. Two Imbonerakure and the sub-hill chief assaulted a civilian in Rwibaga, Ijenda for being a political opponent.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 17 June. Imbonerakure members continued attacks on CNL supporters and teachers in Bubogora, Murwi, leaving the CNL members injured. This is an ongoing event from the previous day.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 June. Imbonerakure beat CNL supporters in Kibuye, Isale after they were returning from the opening ceremonies of a party building.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 June. Imbonerakure members interrupted a CNL party meeting in Mura, by throwing stones at the attendees. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 June. Imbonerakure members attacked CNL supporters who were all teachers with clubs in Bubogora, Murwi, leaving the CNL members injured. Imbonerakure members claim the CNL teachers were in possession of rifles.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 June. Imbonerakure members clashed with police forces at the CNL party residence in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural. Imbonerakure were firing at the CNL residence, which they had burned a few days before, where they were repelled by police. However, some claim the police were working alongside the Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 June. Imbonerakure members attacked and beat 2 CNL supporters in Nkango, Butaganzwa.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 June. Imbonerakure, under order from the Muremera neighborhood chief, attacked, beat and arrested a civilian supporter of the CNL party in Muremera, Giharo. They released him later the same day.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 June. Imbonerakure members attacked and beat CNL supporters for holding a political meeting in Mura, Giharo.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with military forces near the Tanzania border in Muka, Gisagara commune.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 June. Imbonerakure capture, beat, and sexually torture a man after an altercation at a bar in Buhiga, Ngayane.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 June. Imbonerakure members beat a truck driver on the road between Vumbi and Kirundo communes in Kirundo province for a traffic incident.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 June. The CNL party leader of Nyabiyogi was attacked and injured by Imbonerakure members in Nyabiyogi, Kayanza province.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
properties.notes: 14 June. Police arrest and beat civilian supporters of MSD in Kirambi of Bweru, Ruyigi province. The MSD supporters were injured in the attack.

properties.actor1: UFR: Union of Revolutionary Forces
properties.notes: 14 June. UFR-Abahizi members clashed with 20 soldier in Bumba, Rukoyoyo near the Tanzania border. Military forces retreated due to being outnumbered.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 June. Imbonerakure members assaulted a civilian in Kirundo city of Kirundo province following a dispute over the ownership of his bicycle.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 12 June. Police arrested and assaulted 4 civilians for a curfew violation in Gihanga of Bubanza province. 1 civilian was tortured and sent to the hospital.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 June. Imbonerakure members assaulted a civilian secondary student in Rutonganyikwa of Buhiga for his father's CNL party affiliation.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 June. Imbonerakure members burned the meeting house of the CNL party in Nyabiraba, Bujumbura Rural.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 June. 3 civilians leaving a bar in Buhiga of Karuzi province were attacked and beaten by Imbonerakure members for singing songs which reflected poorly on the CNDD-FDD party. The 3 civilians are also Imbonerakure members.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 11 June. Six Imbonerakure members tied up and beat 2 CNL members in Gatakazi, Musongati for joining the CNL party.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 June. CNDD-FDD members tortured 3 Imbonerakure members for not alerting them about an attack the day before in Mpanda, Gahwazi in Bubanza province. After being tortured, the Imbonerakure were transferred to the police.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 10 June. Police forces shoot and kill a civilian in Kinanira area of Bujumbura. While the chief claims this was a thief, others claim he was shouting for help.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 June. Police arrest 3 Imbonerakure members and the chief of the hill as suspects of the attack against CNDD-FDD leader on Rugenge hill, torturing them in prison.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On or before 06 September. Imbonerakure extorted money from bicycle taxis in Bujumbura for CNDD-FDD party contributions. Civilians faced physical threats or bicycle confiscation for non-payment.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 09 June. An unidentified armed group attacked a CNDD-FDD party leader on Rugenge, Butanuka in Bubanza by shooting at his home. No casualties were reported.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 09 June. Three unidentified bodies are found in the river at Nyamusasa hill of Kinyinya, Ruyigi province. These may be in connection with armed activity around Nduta refugee camp across the border in Tanzania.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 09 June. Imbonerakure and other CNDD-FDD members attacked and injured CNL supporters at Gitwenzi, Ntega commune.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 08 June. Protesters demonstrate in Gitega city of Buraza against French media sources coverage of news in Burundi, especially their coverage of human rights violations and violence against women. [size=4000]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 08 June. A group of 6 armed men attacked and injured a civilian member of CNDD-FDD party in Nderama, Bumba area.
