properties.notes: 08 June. Protesters, organised by Aime-Pascal Nduwimana of African Ministry of Compassion, demonstrate against French media coverage of events in Burundi along the 28 November road in Bujumbura. [size=thousands]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 07 June. An unidentified armed group clashed with a soldier in Kinyinya, Rukaramu near the airport, injuring the soldier.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 06 June. An unidentified armed group burned the home of a CNDD-FDD party member, killing a man, woman and child inside.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 June. Imbonerakure members beat 7 civilians associated with the CNL party, as well as destroying and looting some of their property, on Muhororo hill of Mageyo zone in Mubimbi. Other civilians fled following the attacks.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 04 June. Police forces clash with an unidentified armed group of 8, who had kidnapped a woman near the Tanzania border, in Gisuru. Police forces kill 3 of the armed group in the fighting and arrest the others.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 04 June. An unidentified armed group abducted a woman from Gisuru, Ruyigi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 04 June. An unidentified armed group attacks two civilians with machetes, leaving severe injuries in Bugera of Gikuyo.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 June. Imbonerakure members kidnap a civilian member of CNL in Bikanka area of Mukike commune ahead of his appointment as the head of the CNL in the Bikanka area.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 June. 2 Imbonerakure members attacked 3 CNL party members in Gihinga, Gitobe for holding political meetings.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 June. Imbonerakure members attacked an off-duty soldier on Santunda, Gitobe, in Kirundo province.

properties.actor1: Nyabitsinda Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 June. The chief of Nyabitsinda and two others tortured a goldsmith by taking needles to his genitals, accusing him of gold theft. Eventually, the chief released the goldsmith, who was taken to a hospital.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 02 June. A communal party leader of the CNDD-FDD attacked a civilian of the Batwa ethnic group for smoking hemp in Gisekuro.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 01 June. Imbonerakure members attacked 3 CNL supporters for political propaganda in support of Agathon Rwasa in Nyabikenke, Kigina.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 01 June. Imbonerakure members attacked a CNL supporter for leaving the CNDD-FDD to support Rwasa in Karama, Rango.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 30 May. Imbonerakure members attacked civilian members of UPRONA and demanded a ransom to their father to keep them out of jail. The civilians escaped, but Imbonerakure members followed them home to demand the ransom.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 29 May. Military forces fired live rounds at farmers in Cabiza area of Gihanga, Bubanza to prevent them from reaching their fields. Farmers claim the soldiers are keeping them from their crops to pressure them to sell the crops and give money to the soldiers.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 28 May. An angry mob burned ten homes of Batwa civilians in Kigamba following the rape and murder of a young girl by two Batwa men. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: Near 28 May. An unidentified armed group kills a taxi-moto driver and leaves the body in the Kigwena forest reserve in Rumonge.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 May. 4 civilians killed by an unidentified armed group in Kanga area of Kinama in Bujumbura. Some from local security committees may have been among those killed.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 28 May. A CNL party activist is arrested and beaten by Imbonerakure and the communal administrator in Kigina of Nyamurenza in Ngozi. The activist is held in prison in Nyamurenza.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 May. An unidentified armed group kills an Imbonerakure member guarding the Ijenda Post Office in Mugongomanga.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 May. Three Imbonerakure members attack a civilian member of the CNL party on Gatwe Hill of Kizuka district in Rumonge.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and injured a civilian in Gashanga, Bugenyuzi. Imbonerakure members accused the man of beating his wife while they were in a bar.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 May. Imbonerakure members attack a CNL party member in Yaranda, for hosting a meeting to support Rwasa in his home.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 May. Imbonerakure members destroyed. the crops of a CNL party representative in several locations in and near Kiringanire of Kananira, Ngozi province.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 May. Four Imbonerakure members attacked and injured 4 civilians associated with the CNL party in Runini, Tangara.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Second half of May. Imbonerakure destroyed an UPRONA party office on Rushimabarimyi, Ruziba.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 22 May. CNDD-FDD militants beat a CNL supporter, as well others who tried to help him, in Butambara. They took his money and released him after a communal administrator intervened.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and injured a civilian, a member of UPRONA, in Buzirasazi area of Buhayira of Rugano.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 20 May. A group of police officers shoot and kill another police officer in Kabuyenge of Mukenke, suspected to be a retaliatory killing for killing another officer the day before.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 19 May. A police officer shoots and kills another police officer in Bwambarangwe of Mukenke.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 May. Imbonerakure members attack civilians who support the CNL party in Gasorwe commune of Muyinga, killing 2 civilians and injuring others.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 May. A group of Imbonerakure, accompanied by police, disrupted a political meeting and attack five civilians associated with CNL in Murungurira of Ntega commune.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Teachers (Burundi)
properties.notes: 17 May. Imbonerakure beat up a civilian teacher and member of CNL in Murungurira, Ntega.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: Former CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation; Farmers (Burundi); CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: On 15 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a rice farmer who was a former FNL rebel and CNL supporter in or near Muregeza (Mpanda, Cibitoke). The farmer had recently left the CNL to join the CNDD-FDD.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Former FNL: National Forces of Liberation
properties.notes: On 15 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a former FNL Major and CNL supporter in Nyamabere (Mpanda, Cibitoke).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted five CNL party members in Kivoga, Ngozi. The assailants also stole the belongings of the victims before taking them to the communal prison. The assailants accused the victims of holding an illicit meeting.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a former journalist with machetes in Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Marie. The former journalist had previously faced judicial prosecution for covering the activities of armed actors in Burundi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 May 2019. Imbonerakure and police officers, armed with clubs and machetes, went to the homes of CNL members in Martyazo, some of whom they detained and tied up. At least one person was injured by the assailants.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted approximately 25 CNL party members with clubs in Nyamurenza, Ngozi. One victim was left in critical condition.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
properties.notes: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted and injured FRODEBU opposition party members who were holding a meeting in Muramba, Makamba.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Butare, Ngozi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 May 2019. Imbonerakure tortured and injured an elderly man in Mukingo, Kayogoro (no coordinates available). The assailants accused the man of illegally making alcohol. The victim was then taken to prison.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 11 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a woman accused of witchcraft in Masha, Cibitoke. The victim was seriously injured.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 11 May 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked an Imbonerakure patrol at a check-point in Rubira, Mpanda (no coordinates available). The attackers clashed with police and Imbonerakure for one hour, killing one Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 11 May. Imbonerakure members forced civilians supporting CNL to attend a CNDD-FDD meeting in Nyamurenza, Ngozi province. The group beat 25 civilians who refused to attend.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 11 May 2019. During the night, two grenades were thrown into a home in Kavomo, Kirundo. One man was killed and his wife was seriously injured. Locals suspect family members were behind the attack, due to a land dispute.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two off-duty police officers in Muramvya, Muramvya with clubs. Two of the perpetrators were later arrested, while others fled.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: On 10 May 2019, members of a coffee cooperative demonstrated in Kumasanganzira, near Kiremba (Kiremba, Ngozi) over salary payments from 2018. Police forces shot at the demonstrators, injuring two. Some sources indicated one of the demonstrators was targeted due to his role with the former armed forces. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 May 2019. An unidentified armed assailant shot and killed an Imbonerakure member who was walking home in the Mirango neighborhood of Kamenge, Bujumbura Marie. Another civilian was also injured.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 09-10 May. Imbonerakure members attacked and detained 10 supporters of the FNL party in Biyorwa, Ruyigi. Imbonerakure use machetes and iron bars to intimidate the civilians, cutting the ear of two civilians before turning them over to the police.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 09 May 2019. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade at a home in Muramvya, Muramvya. Minor damage was done to the property.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 08 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Rwibikara, Kirundo after accusing the victim of holding a political meeting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 07 May 2019. Imbonerakure tied up and tortured a man accused of stealing in Kayogoro, Makamba. The assailants detained the man in a store owned by a local administrator for one night.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 07 May 2019. A body was discovered in Rukana, Cibitoke. According to police sources, Imbonerakure accused the victim of being a thief and killed him with machetes.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 06 May 2019. Members of the Batwa ethnic group demonstrated in front of the Cibitoke public prosecutors office, demanding justice in the case of a Batwa man who had been murdered. A scuffle broke out between a journalist covering the demonstration and a local administrator. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service; CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On 5 May 2019, an unidentified armed group abducted a SNR informant and CNDD-FDD supporter, as well as 2 Imbonerakure, from Kagwema hill (Gihanga, Bubanza). The 2 Imbonerakure were released shortly afterwards.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 05 May 2019. CNDD-FDD elements severely assaulted three CNL party members in Kinama, Muyinga.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 05 May 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three CNL party members, including a woman, in Randa, Kayanza. The assailants also stole money from the victims.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 May 2019. An unidentified armed group threw a grenade into a home in Musha, Ruyigi. No one was injured.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 03 May 2019. An Imbonerakure and local CNDD-FDD leader assaulted a man in Kayogoro, Makamba.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 May 2019. An unidentified group severely assaulted an elderly woman accused of witchcraft in Maramvya, Karuzi.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 May 2019. Members of the Batwa ethnic group demonstrated in front of the Cibitoke public prosecutors office demanding justice, after the body of a murdered Batwa was discovered. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 01 May 2019. Police arrested, tied-up, and tortured a man in Caratsi, Kayanza. The police accused the victim of trafficking goods from Rwanda, but local sources indicate he was detained for refusing their extortion attempts.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 30 April 2019. Three minors were tortured by police after they escaped from the prison in Murwi, Cibitoke. The victims were originally arrested for theft.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 30 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted two men, including a CNL party member, in Cimba, Gitega. The assailants accused the victims of holding an illicit meeting.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 29 April 2019. Imbonerakure killed a man in Rutegama, Bujumbura Rural after the victim caught them stealing. The perpetrators were arrested.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 April 2019. An unidentified group killed two women accused of witchcraft in Buyongwe, Cankuzo. Two suspects were arrested.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 April 2019. An unidentified group attacked a man accused of witchcraft in Mirombero, Cibitoke. Police intervened and took the victim for medical treatment.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 28 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Nyagumba, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). The assailants accused him of domestic abuse, but the victim's wife refuted this and reported the assailants attacked her husband because he left the Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 April 2019. Two Imbonerakure militants beat a CNL party member in Kiremba, Muyinga.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted the Butaganzwa CNL party leader in Nkango, Kayanza. The assailants also stole beer and goods from the man's shop.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Mabanda, Makamba for being out at night. They also stole money from the victim.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 24 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a Tutsi man in Jimbi, Makamba. Following the assault, they took the man to prison.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
properties.notes: 24 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted three FRODEBU supporters (including a woman) in Mabanda, Makamba.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 22 April 2019. CNDD-FDD militants tortured a CNL party member in Tangara, Muyinga.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 22 April 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked the police station in Gihanga. Sources differ on the fatalities, with some reporting only one civilian fatality and other sources indicating two police officers and one attacker were killed during the clash.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 21 April 2019. An unidentified armed group ambushed a vehicle in Rugombo, Cibitoke. Police responded and repelled the attackers.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 April 2019. A fight erupted between Imbonerakure and CNL party members in Rukira, Muyinga. The Imbonerakure had come to the home of the CNL members to assault them when the CNL members fought back. Police arrested several of the CNL members. Two of the CNL later died from their injuries.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 19 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNL party member in Nyarusange, Kayanza after he showed someone a picture of Rwasa.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 18 April 2019. During the night, an unidentified armed group killed a CNL party member in his home in Musenyi, Bubanza. Police later arrested Imbonerakure and CNL members.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 17 April 2019. An unidentified armed group attacked a police officer in Ruhande, Gitega. The officer escaped.

properties.actor1: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 16 April 2019. During the night, FNL-Nzabampema fighters killed a member of the CNDD-FDD political party in Nyaruhisha, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). Locals caught the perpetrators and handed them over to the police.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 16 April 2019. A police officer shot and killed a student in Musaga, Bujumbura. The student had been arguing with a friend, when a group of police officers on patrol approached them.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.notes: 16 April 2019. SNR detained and assaulted three members of the CNL in Mutumba, Karuzi. The security officials took the detainees to a prison in Karuzi, according to a police source, the detainees were assaulted with a stick during their interrogation.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 April 2019. An Imbonerakure militia member assaulted an UPRONA party member in Murama, Kirundo.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 15 April 2019. A police officer shot and killed a man after a dispute in Mugina, Cibitoke. The officer was arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Month of April. Imbonerakure beat CNL supporters in Ngozi province with sticks, barbed wire and cable. Later, they were arrested for two weeks.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 April 2019. Imbonerakure assaulted the Mutaho CNL leader in Gerangabo, Mutaho.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 March. Imbonerakure assaulted a porter in Nkonyovu, Muramvya for arguing with one of his colleagues.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 March. Imbonerakure cut a street vendor with a blade in Kirundo. The assailants wanted to confiscate the vendor's goods.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 March. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a CNL party member in Nyabiyogi, Kayanza. Following the assault the perpetrators took the victim to prison.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 March 2019. Police arrested and tortured four Imbonerakure who had allegedly stolen a weapon from a police officer in Ruhehe.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 March. Unidentified armed men threw a grenade at a man in a bar in Ngarama, Rutana. The man was injured.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 02 March. A police officer opened fire in a bar in Gatumba following a disagreement. Three people were killed.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Women (Burundi)
properties.notes: 01 March. An Imbonerakure militia member in Rutenderi, Makamba attempted to kill his wife with a knife because she was a CNL party member. The perpetrator was arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 01 March (on or around). Two bodies were found floating the Rweru Lake, near Sigu. Several bodies have been spotted in the lake during the past few weeks. The government claims they are coming from Rwanda, which also borders the lake, and prohibits the locals from recovering them.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 28 February. An Imbonerakure militia member stabbed a school administrator who caught him stealing in Kirundo. The population attempted to catch the attacker but his brother, who is also an Imbonerakure member, helped him escape.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 28 February. Imbonerakure detained and assaulted two women, accused of illegally selling alcohol in Yagumba, Cibitoke (no coordinates available). Angry locals were ready to attack the Imbonerakure but soldiers intervened. The women were taken to the prison.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 February (on or around). Over 70 Imbonerakure received paramilitary training by the military in Mugerama and Bukeye in Nyanza-Lac. The Imbonerakure are reportedly receiving the training before being deployed to fight Burundian rebels in the DRC.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 27 February. A police officer accidentally shot and wounded a man in a bar in Kara, Muyinga.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 26 February. Imbonerakure and an off-duty police officer attacked a farmer with machetes in Bihororo, Gitega. The victim was accused of purchasing stolen fertilizer. The attackers were not arrested.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 February. Imbonerakure and soldiers detained illegal miners in the Kibira forest in Mabayi. They stole the minerals from the miners then shot and killed them. The bodies of four miners were discovered near Gafumbegeti. However, some sources indicate six victims.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 February. Police and Imbonerakure clashed at a checkpoint in Vyanda, Bururi. The clash followed a dispute between the groups on who would receive a bribe at the checkpoint. Injuries were reported.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a man, whom they accused of not participating in communal work, in Cimba, Gitega. Following the assault they took the victim to the prison where he was held over night.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 February. Police and Imbonerakure detained and assaulted a CNL party member in the Kibaza neighborhood of Gahwazi, Mpanda. The CNL member was arrested on accusations of holding party meetings.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 February. Imbonerakure and the local administrator of the Mugera district in Mishiha assaulted a man in Kaniha, Cankuzo. The attackers also assaulted those who attempted to intervene. The victim was accused of organizing an insurrection in the community, however, it is reported that he was targeted over a land dispute.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 24 February. An unidentified armed group fired shots and threw a grenade at police in Mpanda. The assailants also looted stores next to the police.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 24 February. Four Imbonerakure militia members attacked a CNDD-FDD party member who came to collect a debt owed to him by one of the Imbonerakure in Gitanga, Karuzi. Two of the assailants were later arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 24 February. A grenade was thrown into a home in Kadende, Muyinga. One person was injured. A relative of the victim was later arrested.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 24 February. A man beat his neighbor with a club over a land dispute in Ruhuma. [size=2]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 February. SNR agents along with Imbonerakure assaulted an off-duty soldier in Muha. Local residents forced the assailants to take the victim to the hospital. The victim was arrested after receiving treatment at the hospital.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 February. Two unidentified assailants beat the local Imbonerakure leader with clubs in Gitongo. The attack was carried out in retaliation for abuses committed by the Imbonerakure. [size=3]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 February. An Imbonerakure member raped a 13 year old girl in Murwi, Cibitoke. He was not arrested despite the families efforts to press charges.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 22 February (on or before). Five bodies could be seen in Lake Rweru, four were visible from Gatare and a fifth was seen at Nyagisozi. Two of the bodies had been stabbed through by a piece of wood. Locals in the area were prohibited by officials from retrieving bodies in the lake.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 February. Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a CNL party supporter in Mukike.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 22 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted two women for being out at a bar in Murwi, Cibitoke.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 22 February. A CNDD-FDD party leader in Bubanza, seriously assaulted four students over theft allegations. One of the students was hospitalized in critical condition.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 February. Imbonerakure militia members beat a CNL member to death with clubs in Gahise, Kayanza.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 20 February. Police violently assaulted a man before arresting him in Mugara. Local residents had accused the man and three others of witchcraft.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 19 February. Imbonerakure abducted two men who were crossing back into the country from Rwanda at the border crossing in Gasenyi.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 18 February. Unidentified assailants killed an elderly man with a machete in Gisuru. The attack is believed to stem from witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: Ntende Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 18 February. A witch doctor was beheaded by a group who posed as customers in Ntende, Ruyigi. According to local sources, the attack stemmed from his profession or a land conflict.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 19 February. An Imbonerakure raped a teenage girl in Shari, Bubanza. The local CNDD-FDD officials reportedly allowed the perpetrator to flee.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 February. During the night, a Rwasa (CNL) supporter was assaulted by Imbonerakure in Bweru.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 17 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD party member in Butezi before taking him to the prison. The victim was accused of not actively participating in party activities.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted a CNL supporter in Mubavu, Ruyigi.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 February. Imbonerakure militia members assaulted a man, whom they accused of adultery. Another civilian attempted to intervene and was also attacked. The assailants took the original victim to a swamp where they severely beat him and left him for dead. The victim was found the following day and taken for medical attention.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 17 February. A CNDD-FDD member raped a 13 year-old girl in Ruvumu, Cankuzo. The local Imbonerakure waited a day before going to arrest the assailant, during which time the perpetrator fled.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 February. Imbonerakure abducted a man in Murama. The perpetrators were suspicious of the abductee who was not from the area. After interrogating him for seven hours they released him.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 February. Imbonerakure assaulted an UPRONA supporter in a bar in Mabanda. Two of the perpetrators were arrested, while the third drove the victim to the hospital.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 February. Two grenades went off near the home of an opposition member in Nyamaboko. The police and Imbonerakure detained four opposition members from the targeted party following the attack.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 15 February. Police assaulted a man before arresting him in Bujumbura Marie (no town reported).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: Month of February. A CNL regional representative is abducted by Imbonerakure in Cibitoke province.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: COMIBU: Islamic Community of Burundi; Islamic Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: COMIBU: Islamic Community of Burundi; Islamic Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 February. COMIBU members assaulted another member, who they accused of witchcraft, in Makamba. The elites of COMIBU reportedly mistreat members who belong to the political opposition and those who are not affiliated with political parties.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 February. An Imbonerakure member raped a 13 year-old girl in Gihinga.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.notes: 14 February. A military officer and SNR agent detained two refugees who were returning to Nyanza-Lac (unclear where they were detained). The security officers bound and beat the returnees, accusing them of being rebels. Residents of Musenyi went to the police, who secured the release of the returnees.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 14 February. The SNR detained a former FDD rebel in Bubezi, Kayanza. The security forces reportedly accused the man of belonging to a rebel group in the DRC. The victim's family cannot locate the man in any detention facility.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 14 February. Imbonerakure assaulted three civilians in Cumba for being out at night. They then took the civilians to the prison where they were held over night.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 February. The Muramvya police chief's driver assaulted an Imbonerakure member in Nyarunazi after the police chief accused him of taking his cigarette.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 11 February. During the night, an unidentified armed group attacked Buramata, Gihanga. The group attacked a civilian, looted a bar, and fired shots at a church and a civilian vehicle. Imbonerakure and police attempted to respond but the armed group had superior fire power.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 11 February. During the night, Imbonerakure broke into a house in the Nyamugari neighborhood of Gitega. The homeowner stabbed one of the intruders, injuring him.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 February. Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kaguhu, Gasorwe. The perpetrators had ordered the victim to pay them a fine but he did not have the money to do so.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 October. Imbonerakure destroyed two plantations of a CNL zone leader in Kananira zone, Tangara for his refusal to leave the CNL party.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 09 February (on or before). The head of an unidentified man was found in Carama. Military socks and boots were found at the location. Police launched an investigation.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 09 February. An unidentified group set fire to the home of a man (who was a member of the CNDD-FDD) accused of witchcraft in Burimbi, Cibitoke. The man and two of his children died in the fire.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: On or before 02 September. A CNL supporter was found dead in Kivoga, Mutimbuzi. Local sources believe Imbonerakure conducted the attack.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 September. 25 Imbonerakure beat up a civilian CNL supporter in Yoba area of Gitega city.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNL: National Congress for Liberation; Students (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy; Students (Burundi)
properties.notes: 02 September. Disagreements between CNDD-FDD and CNL student supporters erupted into violence at the University of Burundi, Nzega campus. CNL supporters said that University administration has reduced their stipend because of their political affiliation. [size=no report]

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 08 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a Rwasa (CNL) supporter in Mirombero, Murwi. The attackers accused the victim of fighting with his wife. Rwasa just formed a new party called the CNL.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group killed a man during an attack on the Lumitel communication company in Muyange (no coordinates available, located in the Nyarusange area). The perpetrators also destroyed a generator.

properties.actor1: Rumonge Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 07 February. A mob of people attacked a man accused of being a witch doctor in the Nkayamba neighborhood of Rumonge. The attackers wounded the man with a machete.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 06 February (on or before). Residents of Kinyankonge and Nyabagere protested in Bujumbura over land seizures by the government.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted an elderly man, accused of witchcraft, in Bugabira. They also demanded money from the victim.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a child who was selling food items in Bubanza, after the child asked them to pay for the goods they consumed.

properties.actor1: Kararire Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 06 February. An unidentified group threw a grenade into a home in the Kararire neighborhood of Kagege. The attack is reported to stem from witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 February (on or before). A motor-taxi resisted a bribe to a police officer, who then attempted to seize the drivers' bike. At which time, other drivers reportedly threw stones at the police officer, who responded by shooting and killing the driver.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 04 February. Imbonerakure assaulted a CNDD-FDD member in Butezi for not following their instructions on assaulting and intimidating the civilian population. The police did not take any action after the victim filed a complaint against the Imbonerakure members.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 February. A group of Imbonerakure assaulted a police officer and stole his weapon in Matongo. Other police officers responded by firing into the air to disperse the attackers. Nine Imbonerakure members were arrested over the incident.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 February. A woman was severely beaten by locals after she was accused of stealing potatoes in Biganda. The woman suffered a miscarriage as a result of the attack.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 February. A grenade was thrown into a bar in Kaburantwa, injuring seven people.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 February (on or before). A grenade was thrown into a home in Rugasa, injuring two people. The perpetrator is believed to be a local resident who fled after the attack.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 February (on or before). A female body was discovered along the Ruvubu river in Shombo. Local sources believe the victim had been killed elsewhere before being dumped into the river.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.notes: 02 February. A contingent of Burundian soldiers crossed back into the Cibitoke province from the DRC, where they had carried out operations against Red TABARA and other Burundian armed groups.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 01 February. Imbonerakure from Musanga attacked a group of herders from Vugizo, whom they believed were responsible for bush fires. The two groups clashed (both sides assumed armed).

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 31 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stole the weapons of two police officers in Kibati, Cibitoke. The military intervened and detained the Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 31 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL-Rwasa member in Cewe, Kirundo. Some speculate that the family was targeted over their political affiliation, while others believe the attack was due to witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 30 January (on or before). Imbonerakure seriously assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter with sticks and drowning for refusing to join the CNDD-FDD.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Agency
properties.notes: 30 January. Two members of the political opposition were arrested and tortured by the national intelligence service in Gatete, Rumonge. The detainees were involved in a land dispute with a CNDD-FDD leader and the intelligence officers accused them of conspiring with armed groups.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 28 January. Police raided the home of an FNL member in Gabaniro and seized grenades.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 27 January. Three armed men attacked a CNDD-FDD member near the Nyabikere dam. The victim was stabbed in the face but managed to escape.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 27 January. Unidentified perpetrators threw a grenade into a bar in Buterere. The local Imbonerakure leader and his wife were injured in the attack, along with six others.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.notes: 27 January. An unidentified armed group from the DRC attacked a military position in the Rukoro forest, near Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 27 January (on or before). A body was discovered in the Ruvyironza river near Giheta. The victim appeared to have been killed then dumped into the river.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.notes: 27 January. Military forces were ambushed by rebels from the DRC in the Rukoko forest, Gihanga. Three soldiers were killed and others were seriously injured. Additional soldiers were deployed to the Rukoko Nature Reserve following the attack, while access to the reserve was banned.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 26 January. Police and the local chief tied-up and tortured a man in Butamuheba. They held the man over night while they tortured him to confess to impregnating a woman.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 26 January. A man was killed in Gisuma (no coordinates available), in the Rugabano district. The attack is believed to be related to witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 26 January. A mob destroyed the home of a family accused of witchcraft in the Gihwanya neighborhood of Rumonge.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 26 January. A grenade was thrown into the Gifurwe market. Five suspects were later arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 26 January (on or around). The body of a CNDD-FDD member was discovered in Busimba. The victim's arms and tongue had been cut off.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 26 January. A grenade was thrown into a market in Mpanda.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
properties.notes: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a member of the FRODEBU in Mirango. They accused him of adultery.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 25 January. A FNL-Rwasa member was beaten to death in his home in Kigarama by suspected Imbonerakure members

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 25 January. A grenade was thrown into the home of a FNL Rwasa member in Cewe. Local sources believe the family was targeted over witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and stripped a man in Ngugo. They also stole his phone. The perpetrators were arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 January. A member of the Imbonerakure raped a teenager in Rwamvura. The perpetrator was arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 23 January. Imbonerakure assaulted, detained, and extorted money from a woman in Gashingwa.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 21 January. Police in Kabanga arrested a youth, they suspected of supporting rebels. They assaulted the youth in the prison and later transferred him and another suspect to a prison in Busoni.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 21 January. Residents in the Birimba neighborhood of Rumonge, caught a robber and killed him. Three of the perpetrators were arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 21 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a woman in Nyamutobo. The perpetrators said that Tutsi were not permitted in the chief's bar.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 20 January. Police arrested a youth in Kabanga. They accused him of supporting rebels and repeatedly beat him. On 21/01 they transferred him to a prison in Busoni.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 20 January. An Imbonerakure member in Jimbi beat a man over the head with a bottle. The perpetrator was arrested.

properties.actor1: Kinzanza Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 19 January (on or before). A resident of Kinzanza was killed by his neighbors following a land dispute.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 19 January. A grenade was thrown at a group of people, including a police officer, in Mutakura. Three people were killed and others were injured.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 17 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two women in the Kamege area of Murwi. They then took the women to the police, who detained them for two days.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted and detained a school director in Gasenyi until a ransom was paid.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted the chief in Nyakibari. The perpetrators were later arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a man with clubs in his home in Mugimbu. They targeted the man over witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 January. Angry residents in Butaganzwa beat a man to death with clubs. They believed he was responsible for stabbing two locals earlier in the day.

properties.actor1: Butaganzwa Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 January. A man and his son were stabbed to death in Butaganzwa. Local leaders suspect they were killed over a land dispute.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 January (on or before). The body of an Imbonerakure member, who worked for the aviation authority, was discovered in Bujumbura. The victim appeared to have been strangled to death.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 January. A Tutsi was abducted from Ngozi by unknown perpetrators on 15/01. His body was discovered in Kayanza on 16/01. Local sources suspect the victim was targeted due to his ethnicity.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 January (on or before). A body was discovered in Bugiga, the victim had been tied up and strangled. According to locals, the body had not been deceased long as it had no signs of swelling.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction); Women (Burundi)
properties.notes: 14 January. A CNDD-FDD leader assaulted a female Rwasa supporter in a shop in Cimba.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 13 January. A group of youth in Mugoboka (no coordinates available, located in south Mutanga) accused a man, suffering from psychological problems, of being a rebel and beat him to death.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 13 January. Two men were killed in Nyaruganda by locals (assumed unarmed) who suspected them of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 January. Soldiers assaulted two Imbonerakure members in Kiyonza in retaliation for an attack on a soldier by Imbonerakure on 09/01.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 January. After catching suspected robbers in Rugabano, Imbonerakure and security forces tortured the suspects.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 January. Imbonerakure detained and assaulted the chief of the Busaga neighborhood in Kinzanza for being out during the night. Police intervened, securing the release of the chief.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 12 January. A member of Amizero yAbarundi was arrested and tortured by police in Nyamitanga. As of 15/12 he remained in police custody. The police have denied torturing the detainee.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 11 January. Military forces stationed near Munibhere (no coordinates available), between Sehe and Nyagumba shot at suspected rebels in the Kibira forest.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a teenager in Rambo with clubs.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: On or before 01 October. A dead body was found near the Rweru river in Nyagisozi, Kirundo. Local residents say the SNR carried out the attack, as they saw a leader of the SNR in the area just before the body was found. This is speculation and has not been confirmed. The body was quickly buried without an investigation.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 January. Imbonerakure severely assaulted two brothers during a patrol in Muhweza.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 09 January. Armed men in military fatigues killed a CNDD-FDD member in Bukinanyana, after stealing money from him and his wife. Unknown identity of perpetrator coded as UAG.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 09 January. Imbonerakure members attacked a soldier in Kiyonza.

properties.actor1: Mukoma Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 08 January (on or before). A 60 year old man was killed in Mukoma over a mining dispute.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 08 January. Imbonerakure with clubs, bows and arrows beat a man in Buhiga for being out during the night and took him to the police station.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 08 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a merchant in Munyika for selling their coals without repaying them for the product.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 January. Imbonerakure beat and stabbed a man who was crossing from DRC into Burundi during the night, near Rugombo. Two arrests were made following the attack.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 06 January. Imbonerakure assaulted four members of theAmizero yAbarundi in Nyamitanga.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 January. A grenade was thrown into a house in Kavomo, injuring three people - including children.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 05 January (on or before). Imbonerakure and police in Rugombo have robbed and assaulted the local population. One man was beaten by the police for not giving them a beer, while another man was robbed by the group.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 05 January. Members of the CNDD-FDD destroyed the home of a FNL-Rwasa supporter.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 05 January. Armed men beat a woman suspected of witchcraft. They also destroyed her home.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: UPD-Z: Union for Peace and Development (Zigamibanga Faction)
properties.notes: 05 January. The UPD-Zigamibangaen leader in Butaganzwa was assaulted by Imbonerakure.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 05 January. Imbonerakure beat a woman in Mudaturwa, accusing her of witchcraft. After her husband filed a complaint, the Imbonerakure and local chief fined the man. When he refused to pay, they stole materials from his home to sell.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.actor2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure from Musenyi fought with Imbonerakure and a police officer in Mpanda, after the police officer had arrested one of their friends.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure beat a man accused of witchcraft in Bugera, then turned him over to the police

properties.actor1: Mukimba Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 January. Two men cut the throat of a university student, as they suspected his father of practicing witchcraft. The perpetrators were arrested.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 03 January (on or around). A body was discovered in Gihosha. A local official indicated the person had been killed elsewhere before the perpetrators left the body in Gihosha.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 03 January. Imbonerakure assaulted two members of the Amizero yAbarundi in Rugajo (no coordinates available), Buganda.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 January. A man was beaten with wood planks by four Imbonerakure in Bubanza. One perpetrator was arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa supporter in Kigoganya, then took him to the prison where he was held until the following day hen he paid a fine and promised to join the CNDD-FDD.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 02 January. Imbonerakure assaulted a motorbike driver in Nyakibari. The local chief tried to intervene but was assaulted as well.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 01 January. Police assaulted and arrested a merchant in Murwi for raising his prices.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 01 January. Imbonerakure tortured a 14 year old boy, who was a CNDD-FDD member, in Kigoma, in an attempt to get the boy to confess to raping a child. They later took the boy to the police.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 01 January. Imbonerakure stabbed and robbed a man in Rugombo. Another man was also beaten-up by Imbonerakure on the same night.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 31 December (on or before). A group of residents destroyed a man's home in Gashanga, suspecting him of witchcraft. The police arrested the victim and leader of the perpetrators.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 31 December. A merchant, who belonged to the CNDD-FDD, in Ryamukona was beaten by police before they detained him and transferred him to an unknown location. The police alleged the man had possession of firearms, but locals report that the beating and arrest were done to avoid debts.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 31 December. A FNL-Rwasa supporter was beaten by Imbonerakure in the Ruremba are of Nyakazi for being out past the curfew.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 30 December. The body of a man was discovered in the Mubarazi river in Bugendana. The victim had been tied up with a rope.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FNL-Rwasa member in Gatabo for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 29 December. Imbonerakure beat a CNDD-FDD member to death for not participating in communal work in Nyamirambo (no coordinates available), in the Masango area. The perpetrators were arrested but were released by the area chief.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 December. Protesters gathered in Rumonge, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 December. Protesters marched in Bujumbura, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 December. Protesters demonstrated in Bururi, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 29 December. Protesters gathered in Muramvya, voicing their support for the government and condemning the BBC, EU and Rwanda.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: 27 December (on or before). A Rwandan trader was apprehended by Imbonerakure in a Cibitoke market. The Imbonerakure beat the man and stole his money before taking him to the SNR police. The police then tortured the man before taking him to an unknown location.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 25 December. A police officer shot a member of the Imbonerakure (assumed unarmed) in Kinyinya.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 24 December. A body, which showed signs of torture and bullet wounds, was discovered on the shore of Lake Tanganyika in Bujumbura.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 23 December. A man stealing sweet potatoes was killed by an unknown group. Assumed mob violence.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 21 December. Two suspected thieves were caught by locals in Kavumwe. The group beat one to death and police intervened to save the other.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 21 December. An unidentified group killed a CNDD-FDD member and injured the man's wife.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: MSD: Movement for Solidarity and Democracy
properties.notes: 20 December. The president of the MSD party in Ngoro was assaulted by the Imbonerakure chief.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 20 December. Imbonerakure assaulted two civilians in Hamure.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 19 December. A police officer was abducted in Ruhororo. The zone chief and eight others were arrested in connection with the abduction.

properties.actor1: Kavomo Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 19 December. A woman and three of her children were killed by a grenade in Kavomo. Three other children were injured. The attack stemmed from witchcraft accusations and a suspect was arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 18 December. Imbonerakure and police assaulted two men for breaking curfew in Gihanga. One of the men was detained until he paid a fine the following day.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 18 December. An armed group decapitated a man in Mpanda. Arrests were made.

properties.actor1: Marumpu Communal Militia (Burundi)
properties.notes: 16 December. A 50 year-old man was killed with machetes by unidentified attackers. The attack is reported to have stemmed from witchcraft accusations.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 16 December. Heavy military movement was seen around Musigati. Locals indicated that the forces were deployed into the forest to search for armed groups. A local official reported that it was they were carrying out routine operations.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 16 December. According to local sources, Imbonerakure were deployed in Bukinanyana to carry out night patrols between Nyamitanga and Bukinanyana. The Imbonerakure were armed.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Bujumbura protested against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. The protest was organized by the Ministry of Interior and other government agencies.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 15 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a man in Buvumbi for not contributing to the CNDD-FDD election fund and insulting the party. After they beat the man and took him to the local jail.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Gitega protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Kirundo demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. They objected to any bystanders on the side of the road, to prevent anyone from taking pictures.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Ngozi demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Cankuzo protested against the BBC's report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Makamba demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo. Many of the protesters were forced to participate.

properties.actor1: Protesters (Burundi)
properties.assoc_actor_1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
properties.notes: 15 December. CNDD-FDD members in Muramvya demonstrated against the BBC for its report on a torture facility in Kinindo.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 15 December (on or before). Two male bodies were discovered in Gafumbegeti (no coordinates available). They had been killed and tied to trees.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 13 December. A woman was beaten and raped by a group of men in the Banda area of Kibuya village.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 13 December. Two Tutsi members of the Imbonerakure in Mutobo severely assaulted a Hutu motor bike driver when he refused to move his bike. The incident raised tensions among the ethnic groups in the area.

properties.actor1: Rioters (Burundi)
properties.notes: 13 December. Locals in Muyange caught a thief and beat him to death. Police arrested three of the perpetrators.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FRODEBU: Front for Democracy in Burundi
properties.notes: 13 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a taxi driver who did not stop at their checkpoint in Busebwa (no coordinates available). The group accused the driver, a member of FRODEBU, of supporting gangs.

properties.actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Burundi)
properties.notes: 13 December. A dead body with a head injury was discovered in the Ndurumu river between Buhiga and Bugenyuzi.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 12 December. Three male Burundian youths were repatriated from the Rwandan border crossing at Kanyaru due to their age. After crossing through a military station in Cendajuru, they were detained by the military. They were beaten and questioned on their travels then loaded onto a SNR vehicle. They have not been seen or heard from since.

properties.actor1: Amizero yAbarundi
properties.assoc_actor_2: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 12 December. A grenade was thrown at the home of an Imbonerakure member in Gihanga. Police arrested two Amizero y' Abarundi members in connection to the attack, but the local population reports that they were not the perpetrators.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-)
properties.notes: 11 December. Police assaulted a man in Gihogazi for refusing to pay their debt. The officers were later arrested.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.notes: 10 December. Imbonerakure assaulted a FROLINA member in Busembwa (no coordinates available) over a political arguement.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
properties.notes: 10 December. Imbonerakure beat-up six FNL-Rwasa supporters in Mura. The attackers threatened the victims to go into exile or join the CNDD-FDD.

properties.actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
properties.assoc_actor_2: FNL-R: National Forces of Liberation (Rwasa Faction)
